title: Housing Construction Management Intern
company: Jewish Association for Services for the Aged
description:
We are currently seeking an intern who is available to start **immediately**! This is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop valuable skills in a fast-paced environment.  

  

**Shift Schedule:** Monday-Wednesday: 8AM-4PM  

**Hours Per Week:** 21**Internship Duration:** Up to three months


The location of the internship will be a combination from our main office in Midtown and potential assignments that will require visiting our Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Far Rockaway properties. **Internship Overview:**


The Housing Construction Manager Intern will assist the JASA Housing Management team in various tasks and projects in the areas of construction, renovation, facility management, analytics, reporting, inspections, and other management functions. This role offers exposure to all facets of construction and facility management, providing a comprehensive understanding of residential renovations and facility functions and operations within a dynamic organizational setting. **Specific Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Assist with construction site inspections and daily reporting.
* Assist in maintaining contract drawings using AutoCAD to reflect change orders and field change directives.
* Assist in reviewing construction drawings and requests for information.
* Assist with the preparation of spreadsheets for cost estimates, quantity takeoffs, and budget analysis.
* Communicate effectively with all stakeholders.
* Work on a variety of office and field assignments.
* Assist with various organization audits.
* Perform other administrative tasks as assigned.

**Requirements:*** Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or Master's program with a focus on Construction Management, Architecture, Engineering or a related field.
* Strong interest in pursuing a career in construction or facility management (preferred).
* Previous experience in administrative work and/or data entry.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with professionalism.
* Proficiency in Google Workspace, and Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Why Join ADAPT?**  

It's more than a job; it's a calling. It's where passion meets purpose. ADAPT Community Network, formerly United Cerebral Palsy (UCP) of NYC provides a multitude of services to people with developmental disabilities. At ADAPT, we are 3,000 strong, and it takes every one of us to empower the lives of the people we support. With caring and great resources at hand, we know what it takes to help people live fuller, happier, healthier lives. Our employees show their commitment to the people we support every day, and we all deliver on our promise to provide innovative and comprehensive services to individuals with developmental disabilities.


For your next career move, apply with us at ADAPT Community Network! Wherever you work among our many locations around New York City, ADAPT offers paid training, competitive benefits, and we foster a team culture of learning, support, collaboration and career growth.


**SUMMARY**


Under general supervision, is responsible for acting as an “Office Manager” to clerical operations. Provides administrative secretary support to Program Director and other members of his/her staff. Supervises other Administrative Assistants in the department.


**COMPENSATION:** $17.94/hour + Industry-Leading Benefits!


**LOCATION: 3127 Wilkinson Avenue**, **3rd floor, Bronx, NY, 10461**


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


The incumbent in the position will perform all or some of the job duties that are listed below:


* Assigns work to and oversees quality and quantity of completed assignments of Administrative Assistants I, II, and III in department.
* Provides supervision to other Administrative Assistants through regularly scheduled supervision sessions, modeling and coaching.
* Provides information to supervisor for use in performance appraisals or disciplinary action and may sit with supervisor and employee when such review or actions takes place.
* Provides orientation, on-the-job training and follow-up training of other staff members regarding general office procedures and practices of department.
* Greets visitors, ascertains their needs and directs them accordingly.
* Answers telephone and screens calls for Program Director and/or other department staff.
* Works cooperatively with other Administrative Assistants on joint assignments.
* Interacts respectfully with persons receiving services encountered in course of work activities.
* Relays information as necessary from and to bus drivers and/or transportation liaison.
* Directs all important situations, inquiries and questions to supervisor.
* Types records, reports, correspondence, etc.
* Types requisitions for Purchase Orders, tracks delivery of items and forwards packing slips or receiving reports to Purchasing Department.
* Orders and maintains adequate inventory of office supplies.
* Receives, opens, sorts and distributes in-coming mail and packages.
* Records attendance for persons served on monthly calendar for billing purposes.
* Keeps track of staff attendance, vacations and sick leave and verifies accuracy of Time and Attendance forms.
* Maintains a filing system of administrative and program materials and keeps files current.
* Reimburses staff for approved petty cash expenditures, maintains accurate petty cash records and arranges for replenishment as required.
* Performs photocopying as needed.
* Sets up coffee and other refreshments for meetings as requested.
* Gives work assignments, guidance and instructions to Administrative Assistant I and II.
* Performs other related duties as requested.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.
* Excellent interpersonal skills are required in order to interact effectively with employees, co-workers, other departments, outside contacts, etc.
* Due to sensitive nature of the position, must be able to maintain the strictest confidentiality.
* Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Fully conversant with agency selected word processing and spreadsheet computer software programs.
* Knowledge of modern office practices and procedures, including business correspondence, record keeping systems and office equipment
* Knowledge of principles of managing and coordinating administrative, secretarial and/or clerical functions
* Good organizational skills
* Excellent oral and written communications skills
* Must pass agency computer-based software typing examination.


**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE**


* High School Diploma or GED. Some college or secretarial school preferred
* At least three years of related work experience
* Bilingual (Spanish) is a plus but not required


ADAPT Community Network is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified candidates of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and status are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels.

title: Clinical Dietitian II
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Title:** Clinical Dietitian II

**Location:** Richmond University Medical Center (RUMC), Staten Island


Aramark Healthcare+ is seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our dynamic and compassionate healthcare team as a **Clinical Dietitian** at RUMC in Staten Island.


In this role, you will have the opportunity to work in a patient-centered environment, providing top-notch care to a diverse patient population. The Clinical Dietitian will collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, including physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals, to develop and implement personalized nutrition plans for patients.

**COMPENSATION:** The hourly rate or salary range for this position ranges from $70,000 to $80,000, depending on circumstances including an applicant?s skills and qualifications, certain degrees and certifications, prior job experience, market data, and other relevant factors. This is Aramark?s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of compensation for this position as of the time of posting.


If hired, employee will be in an ?at-will position? and Aramark reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time AND FOR ANY REASON, including, BUT NOT LIMITED TO for reasons related to individual performance, Aramark or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Assess patient's nutritional status and develop individualized nutrition plans based on their medical history, current health status, and specific needs
* Provide education and counseling to patients and their families on proper nutrition, healthy eating habits, and lifestyle changes
* Collaborate with healthcare teams to develop and implement clinical protocols and best practices for nutrition care
* Monitor patients' progress and make modifications to their nutrition plans as needed
* Stay up-to-date with the latest research and developments in the field of clinical nutrition


#FS-300

**Qualifications**
------------------

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Nutrition or Dietetics from an accredited institution
* Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) designation required or the ability to obtain RD / RDN
* Licensed Dietitian status in **New York**
* At least 2 years of clinical practice experience
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and teamwork skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
* Strong organizational and time management skills
**Education**
-------------

**About Aramark**
-----------------

**Our Mission**


Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.


At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food and facilities in 15 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

title: Bartender - Parla NYC
description:
***Company Background***

From the beginning, Corner Table has been obsessed with building a positive, supportive environment for our team members, who in turn take great care of our guests. We care about every meal and every moment. We value our team and the culture we have created and hire genuinely great people who get pleasure out of making people happy. We love what we do and are looking for people who share our passion!

***PARLA***


Parla is a spot to celebrate NY-style pizza and Italian-inspired cocktails from the team behind The Smith. Opening this fall on the Upper West Side, Parla is an all-day destination for lunch and dinner, with plans to serve baked goods at breakfast. The square and round pizzas are the anchors of the menu, along with house-made pastas, veggies, and shareable plates created by Executive Chef Brian Ellis. The bar specializes in espresso, wine, and cocktails using a curated selection of amari and vermouth.


We are looking to build a team of talented and passionate hospitality professionals to help us launch Parla. This is a unique opportunity to become a part of and contribute to the opening of a brand-new concept!

***The Position: Bartender***


Position Requirements


* Prepare alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages for bar and restaurant guests
* Extensive knowledge of food and beverage with a strong ability to service, educate, and sell
* Interact with guests, takes orders, and serve drinks and food
* Extensive knowledge of wine and/or spirits history
* Evaluate guest's needs and make recommendations
* Provide excellent service, so guests feel taken care of
* Mix ingredients to prepare cocktails
* Check guests' identification and confirm it meets the legal drinking age
* Comply with all food and beverage regulations
* Pay special attention to all dietary restrictions by informing the kitchen

**Ideal Candidate Qualifications:**

* You have a love and passion for the hospitality industry
* You work hard and never settle
* You have 2-years of experience in a fast-casual dining environment
* You genuinely get joy out of making people happy and are able to have fun while working
* You take pride in your success and the success of those around you
* Ability to read and follow standardized recipes
* Previous experience as a pizza cook or in a similar role preferred

**Benefits:**

* A great environment to work in surrounded by talented, hardworking, passionate, and fun people.
* Competitive salary
* Comprehensive benefits plan, including medical, dental, vision, 401(K), and life insurance.
* Gym Discounts
* Bonus opportunity
* Commuter benefits
* Bring a friend to work bonus

**STATEMENT OF DIVERSITY**


At Corner Table Restaurants, each person brings their own perspectives and experiences. We strive to create an environment that is consciously inclusive, psychologically, and physically safe, and ensures everyone can be heard and valued. Diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace are essential to living our Core Values. We create and promote a culture that advocates for the equality of everyone, and it is our mission to continually maintain an environment where all our team members and guests belong, are respected, and thrive while being their best authentic selves.


Corner Table Restaurants is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 *Hourly Rate of Pay: $16.50 per hour plus tips*

title: Manufacturing Quality Lab Technician
description:
**Internal Description – Quality Lab Technician**

**Description - Internal**

**Job Description:**

* Responsible for making equipment adjustments to ensure proper specifications are met.
* Responsible for performing quality checks and recording results.
* Responsible for changing settings on equipment during changeovers.
* Responsible for properly recording all production numbers into MDIS system.
* Responsible for performing some routine maintenance on equipment.
**Qualifications - Internal**

**Qualifications:**

* Able to work in a manufacturing setting in a safe manner and follow all plant safety rules and practices. Maintain a high standard for housekeeping within the work area.
* Computer skills needed for data entry and reporting. Process will involve quality data or require comments related to the production/loading operation.
* Read and complete documented inspection procedures. Follow instructions on printed work orders to complete assigned tasks.
* Familiar with common hand tools and how to properly use them (hammer, wrench, screwdrivers, pliers, putty knife, spatula, etc.).
* Demonstrate the ability to cooperate with co-workers in areas of safety, quality, production/maintenance, and understand the importance of completing assigned tasks and their relationship to other requirements.


* Adaptable to scheduling requirements including shiftwork, assignment of overtime and call out coverage.


* Possess basic communication and problem-solving skills.


* Possess the ability to become proficient at performing tests and taking measurements as needed to verify product is within specifications.


* Effective teamwork and communication skills needed with all co-workers.


* Maintain regular and predictable attendance.


**External Description – Quality Lab Technician**

**Description - External**

1. Responsible for making equipment adjustments to ensure proper specifications are met  

2. Responsible for performing quality checks and recording results
  

3. Responsible for changing settings on equipment during changeovers.
  

4. Responsible for properly recording all production numbers into MDIS system.
  

5. Responsible for performing some routine maintenance on equipment


**Qualifications - External**

* Able to work in a manufacturing setting in a safe manner and follow all plant safety rules and practices. Maintain a high standard for housekeeping within the work area.
* Computer skills needed for data entry and reporting. Process will involve quality data or require comments related to the production/loading operation.
* Read and complete documented inspection procedures. Follow instructions on printed work orders to complete assigned tasks.
* Familiar with common hand tools and how to properly use them (hammer, wrench, screwdrivers, pliers, putty knife, spatula, etc.).
* Demonstrate the ability to cooperate with co-workers in areas of safety, quality, production/maintenance, and understand the importance of completing assigned tasks and their relationship to other requirements.


* Adaptable to scheduling requirements including shiftwork, assignment of overtime and call out coverage.


* Possess basic communication and problem-solving skills.


* Possess the ability to become proficient at performing tests and taking measurements as needed to verify product is within specifications.


* Effective teamwork and communication skills needed with all co-workers.


* Maintain regular and predictable attendance.


**Additional Information:**

  


Rate of pay may be adjusted based on the qualifications and experience of the candidate.

  

USG employees enjoy a number of benefit options for themselves and their families. These include two medical insurance options, as well as vision and dental coverage. The cost of these optional programs varies based on coverage level - employees generally pay 25% of the monthly premium cost, USG pays the rest. These coverage options are offered on the first day of employment with no waiting period.

  

Additionally, USG employees enjoy both a 401(k) Investment Plan with company match and a pension plan. Beyond these main features, employees may also choose from a number of additional programs like life insurance, accident insurance, legal insurance, even pet insurance, just to name a few. USG also offers Quarterly (hourly) / Annual (salary) bonus potential for all employees based on performance metrics tied to safety, quality, and productivity. USG also provides employees with paid time off and paid holidays.

*Since 1902, Chicago-based USG has been a leader in producing innovative, award-winning products and systems to build everything from major commercial developments and residential housing to home improvements. USG's employees are committed to the highest levels of customer satisfaction and quality in everything we do. Our steadfast commitment to the company's core business values – innovation, quality, integrity, service, diversity, efficiency and safety – have helped us become the company we are today.*

  

*EOE including disability/veteran*

title: Business Development Representative
description:
**Who we are…**


YOOBIC is an AI-powered frontline employee experience platform. Our mobile app gives business leaders and frontline teams the performance tools they need to communicate, learn, and work—all in one place. With streamlined communications, mobile learning, and digitized task management, YOOBIC drives operational excellence while drastically improving the frontline employee working experience. 350+ companies around the world including MattressFirm, Michaels, GameStop, Lacoste, Lidl, Boots, Peloton, Pret, Puma, and Vans trust YOOBIC to improve operational consistency and agility, get real-time visibility into multi-location business execution, and improve customer experience. To learn more about YOOBIC, visit www.yoobic.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

  



  

**What we need…**

  

We’re looking for a high energy, ambitious Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our awesome go to market team in New York. We want an individual that is highly motivated, super creative, great on the phones and interested in becoming an AE. You’ll have the support of a fantastic marketing team and great Account Executives who will actively cheer you on and celebrate your success!  

  



  

**What you'll do…**

* You’ll be responsible for creating a set number of qualified new business opportunities per month
* Partner with Account Executives on the strategic approach to engage our top target accounts
* Use a mix of research, calling, email, and social selling to engage our prospects
* You will work a combination of inbound leads, event leads, nurtured leads and you’ll outbound to our top target accounts (ABM accounts)
* Partner with marketing team to develop creative campaigns to rise above the noise in an email inbox and get the attention of our prospects
* Pay close attention to our vast enablement library to stay sharp on our product differentiators and target personas
* Continually hone your pitch on the phone to better qualify prospects and improve your conversion rate on calls
* Leverage Linkedin in creative ways to engage prospects
* Continually identify new and creative ways to engage prospects using things like gifting, self-recorded videos and other creative tactics
* Understand customer needs and buying cycle to gather key prospect information, generate interest and bring in successful customers
* Do your own research online to create a more customized pitch to engage prospects
* Meet daily, weekly and monthly KPIs

  


**What you have...**

* 9-18 months previous experience in a Business Development or Sales role
* Previous experience cold calling/emailing prospective clients required
* Passionate about startups, entrepreneurship, digital and new technologies and be keen to build something new
* Understand new concepts quickly and possess the ability to explain them with ease
* Great natural curiosity - always looking to learn
* Think commercially and be able to creatively spot opportunities
* Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Self-starter and passionate about driving growth
* Thirst to learn and develop your skills and take feedback well
* Love building new relationships and working collaboratively
* Well organized, autonomous, and able to prioritize work efficiently

  


**What we offer...**

  

* Competitive compensation between $70-80k with an OTE up to $115k
* 20 days PTO + 8 public holidays (plus 3 floating holidays to choose from)
* Medical cover and EAP (Employee Assistance Program)
* Company covered Life insurance coverage
* Company covered long term disability coverage
* An amazing 401k contribution - We contribute even if you don’t!
* ADP discounts for a whole host of items (including electronics, Childcare, travel, etc…)
* Free online HIIT sessions + gym discounts

  

  

  

*We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and we want to ensure that our recruitment process is accessible to everyone. If you have a disability or additional need that requires reasonable accommodations during the process please do not hesitate to let us know. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.*

title: Events Manager
description:
* **Job Title:** Events Manager
* **Salary:** $76,000 - $94,000 per annum, depending on experience, plus a discretionary bonus.
* **Location & Hybrid Working:** This is a hybrid role, with regular travel to our head office located in New York required.

**The role**


We are looking for an Events Manager to join our Marketing team within our Threefold agency (part of the SMG Network)*.* In this role, you will create & deliver our owned, earned & paid events calendar by partnering with key players across the region (industry bodies, competitors & B2B influencers).

**Why SMG?**


SMG is one of the most exciting growth companies in the North America today and is home to the award winning Retail Media Network agency **Threefold.**


Founded in 2008, Threefold is the world's leading Retail Media Network (RMN) specialist, headquartered in both London and New York. As part of the SMG agency network, which employs over 250 retail media experts, Threefold's primary mission is to unlock incremental CPG budgets, curate media campaigns that supercharge sales, and elevate its retail partners into top-tier omni-channel media owners, spanning in-store, offsite and online.


Threefold's services include consultancy, evaluation, and a white-label in-house solution that has seen the agency build, run and operate over 10 Retail Media Networks to date.

  

Today, Threefold run and operate Walgreens' Boots Media Group and Morrisons Media Group, and additional live partners include major retailers like The Co-op, Signet Group and The Very Group.

  

We are dedicated to supporting our employees to be the best version of themselves both inside and outside of work. We have an extraordinary culture built by exceptional people and it’s because of this that we’ve been recognised by Best Companies within the top 5 best Marketing & Media agencies to work for in the UK, with a World Class and Outstanding accreditation across the past 2 years.


We are also dedicated to continuously reviewing and improving our benefits package to offer the best that we can for our people. Here's what's on offer:


Generous discretionary bonus scheme


‍️ $3,510 yearly wellbeing fund (on top of your salary!) towards your personal wellbeing and passions


️‍ Healthcare paid for (dental, medical & vision) with the option to top up for family


Dedicated yearly investment into your professional development and learning


4 additional Wellbeing Days - one to be taken each quarter, dedicated to focusing on your wellbeing

  

Free headspace subscription


4pm Friday finishes all year round


Two fully paid conferences a year at Summer & Winter, as well as a dedicated team that put on activities and celebrations throughout the year

**Why you?**


In line with our company values, within your role you'll want to stay honest, stay hungry, stay foolish, and most importantly, have fun! We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Events Manager with a proven track record in the advertising industry, particularly in ad tech, retail and/or retail media events. The ideal candidate will have event marketing experience, demonstrating exceptional skills in event planning, logistics management, and partner relations. We're looking for a strong executor who is passionate about Events Marketing and can drive SMG's events program growth in North America, someone who excels in creating impactful event experiences while effectively managing budgets, timelines, and stakeholder relationships to achieve measurable business results.  

  

Specifically, you will be able to demonstrate:

* Ability to develop and implement comprehensive annual event strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously, coordinate complex logistics, and ensure flawless execution of events.
* A proven track record in delivering business growth in a fast-paced, challenging environment.
* Experience in an events role in the advertising industry within a Sales organization, preferably with Retail Media experience.
* Skill in cultivating and maintaining strong relationships with clients, partners, and industry professionals.
* Innovative and solution-oriented thinking to increase event value to SMG and our clients & partners.
* The ability to work with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver best-in-class client service, at all times.


*P.s. we try really hard to make sure that we list only essential criteria here, BUT if you think you can do an amazing job, yet don't have every single thing on this list, we'd still love to hear from you.*

**What you'll be doing**


We pride ourselves on creating challenging and exciting opportunities, meaning that no two days are the same. However, here's an idea of what your responsibilities will look like:

  

* **NA Event Strategic Planning:**Develop and implement a comprehensive annual events strategy aligned with SMG NA's business objectives. This includes identifying key industry events, setting goals, and creating a roadmap for successful event participation to support new business and existing client relationships throughout the year.
* **Individual Event Planning & Execution:** Oversee the end-to-end planning and execution of each event, from concept to completion. This encompasses and is not limited to: event selection, sponsorship selection, ROI expectation, SMG attendees, agenda development & coverage, promotion & timing of attendance, speaker coordination, co-sponsor coordination, and ensuring seamless on-site operations.
* **Annual & intra-quarter Budget & ROI Management:** Manage the annual events budget, allocating resources effectively across various events, and forecasting and tracking expenses on an ongoing basis throughout each quarter. Continuously monitor and optimize ROI for each event, making data-driven decisions to maximize the impact of SMG's event investments.
* **Reporting ROI & Analysis of Event Quality:** Develop and implement clear and actionable metrics to measure event success and ROI. Conduct post-event analysis to assess the quality and impact of each event, providing actionable insights for future improvements and recommendations for the same or similar events.
* **Partner Management:** Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with event partners, sponsors, and vendors. Negotiate favorable terms, secure added value opportunities, promote SMG client and leadership inclusion, and ensure all partnerships align with SMG's and our clients’ strategic objectives and brand values.
* **Client Management:** Serve as the primary point of contact for clients attending SMG events - hosted or sponsored, ensuring their needs are met, they are prepped, and expectations exceeded for their objectives from attending an event. Coordinate client participation, including speaking opportunities, networking sessions, and customized experiences with SMG commercial teams and act as the ‘front door’ into SMG teams for clients on all event planning and logistics.
* **Event Campaign Creation:** Work with the Content & Communications Manager to create compelling event marketing campaigns to drive awareness, ‘activation’ attendance and engagement with SMG. This includes coordinating and creating promotional materials, leveraging digital marketing channels such as LinkedIn, supporting outreach plans, securing positive press coverage and collaborating with the marketing team to ensure consistent brand messaging, TOV & look and feel.
* **On-site Leadership Support:** Provide comprehensive support to SMG leadership attending events, including schedule management, briefing materials, and facilitating key meetings and networking opportunities based on the objectives of the business and the event. Ensure executives are well-prepared to represent SMG effectively at all events, curating based on needs of the leader and the function.
* **On-site Operations & Logistics:** Manage all aspects of on-site event operations, including travel, setup, vendor coordination, registration, and client and SMG attendee experience. Troubleshoot issues quickly and efficiently to ensure smooth event execution.
* **Contribution to Organizational Projects:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams on broader organizational initiatives that intersect with events. Provide expertise and insights to enhance SMG's overall marketing and business development strategies. Incorporate learnings from SMG markets to improve the NA Events effectiveness.
* **Co-delivering SMG’s webinar programme:** Work with your counterpart in the UK (Events Manager) to deliver SMGs global digital events programme.


 

**Helping you shine**


We are committed to helping you shine and show your full potential by making any changes you might need throughout your application. If you need an alternative way of applying for this role, support with understanding the role and its requirements, changes to be made to the way we hold our interviews, or anything else, then please reach out to us. You can either let us know on your application form or contact the people team to discuss how we can help on careers@smg.team.


**SMG are proud to be an equal opportunities employer**


We are fully committed to providing equality in the workplace and ensure all opportunities for, and during employment, will be afforded to individuals fairly and irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, race including colour, ethnic or national origins and nationality, religion or belief or sexual orientation ("the protected characteristics"). We want our organisation to reflect the diversity of our communities and we welcome applications from people from all backgrounds. More information on what we are doing can be found here.

title: Digital Media Manager
description:
* **Job Title:** Digital Media Manager
* **Salary:** $97,500 - $117,000 per annum, depending on experience, plus a discretionary bonus.
* **Location & Hybrid Working:** This is a hybrid role, with regular travel to our head office located in New York required.

**The role**


We are looking for a Digital Media Manager to join our Threefold Agency (part of the SMG Network)*.* In this role, you will be leading the planning process across key strategic clients and internal team collaboration to elevate responses, identify the role of channels and measurement approaches, and media set up and activate (with support from the broader media activation team). You will also be a media planning expert and a reliable source of knowledge for the RMN client team, offering guidance and recommendations on channel tactics and out-of-scope media/innovation opportunities.

**Why SMG?**


SMG is one of the most exciting growth companies in the North America today and is home to the award winning Retail Media Network agency **Threefold.**


Founded in 2008, Threefold is the world's leading Retail Media Network (RMN) specialist, headquartered in both London and New York. As part of the SMG agency network, which employs over 250 retail media experts, Threefold's primary mission is to unlock incremental CPG budgets, curate media campaigns that supercharge sales, and elevate its retail partners into top-tier omni-channel media owners, spanning in-store, offsite and online.


Threefold's services include consultancy, evaluation, and a white-label in-house solution that has seen the agency build, run and operate over 10 Retail Media Networks to date.

  

Today, Threefold run and operate Walgreens' Boots Media Group and Morrisons Media Group, and additional live partners include major retailers like The Co-op, Signet Group and The Very Group.

  

We are dedicated to supporting our employees to be the best version of themselves both inside and outside of work. We have an extraordinary culture built by exceptional people and it’s because of this that we’ve been recognised by Best Companies within the top 5 best Marketing & Media agencies to work for in the UK, with a World Class and Outstanding accreditation across the past 2 years.


We are also dedicated to continuously reviewing and improving our benefits package to offer the best that we can for our people. Here's what's on offer:


Generous discretionary bonus scheme


‍️ $3,510 yearly wellbeing fund (on top of your salary!) towards your personal wellbeing and passions


️‍ Healthcare paid for (dental, medical & vision) with the option to top up for family


Dedicated yearly investment into your professional development and learning


4 additional Wellbeing Days - one to be taken each quarter, dedicated to focusing on your wellbeing

  

Free headspace subscription


4pm Friday finishes all year round


Two fully paid conferences a year at Summer & Winter, as well as a dedicated team that put on activities and celebrations throughout the year

**Why you?**


In line with our company values, within your role you'll want to stay honest, stay hungry, stay foolish, and most importantly, have fun! More specifically, you'll have / be:

  

* Strong media planning. Desirable experience working across multiple different retail media networks
* Experience of media buying (Display and social)
* Experience with tensions of metrics and objective setting, driving a client to see results differently
* Understanding of the total media environment, with a focus on retail media or eCommerce
* Strong presentation skills, especially in crafting stories and taking clients along the journey in responses
* Have the drive to continue learning and developing our core media/marketing theory and principles
* Strong teamwork and collaboration skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, prioritising tasks across multiple projects and agencies
* Highly organised, with good attention to detail
* Commercially savvy, with a focus on driving growth and fostering through media innovation and working more strategically
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Good, workable understanding of Excel and PowerPoint
* Good interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong client relationships

*P.s. we try really hard to make sure that we list only essential criteria here, BUT if you think you can do an amazing job, yet don't have every single thing on this list, we'd still love to hear from you.*

**What you'll be doing**


We pride ourselves on creating challenging and exciting opportunities, meaning that no two days are the same. However, here's an idea of what your responsibilities will look like:

  

* Manage the media briefing and recommendations for campaigns, incorporating sophisticated planning approaches and strategies and ensuring that plans meet campaign objectives.
* Lead all digital trading and activation for the RMN. You will be the technical lead for all digital operations and be able to advise on technical implementation challenges and solutions.
* This includes, but is not limited to troubleshooting, conversion tracking build, preview link creation, campaign build, pacing, and optimization.
* Maintain watertight processes and campaign spend tracking to minimize errors and ensure correct tracking of all campaigns and commercials. Continuously improve efficiency through enhancements in processes, frameworks and inefficient campaign monitoring.
* Keeping up to date with media channel opportunities, tech and innovation and that can help inform planning.
* Regularly communicate with internal client and media teams, and external media owners on wider team/business/client updates.
* Understanding campaign results and trends, to help inform future plans.
* Regularly update and track commercials across multiple specific clients and briefs.
* Drive incremental opportunities for our clients.
* Create formalised media plans across designated media channels and assist with creating proposal/pitch content.
* Explore new media opportunities and drive innovation where you see the benefit.
* Update and track commercials regularly (via client and brief), ensuring financial due diligence and strong attention to detail.


 

**Helping you shine**


We are committed to helping you shine and show your full potential by making any changes you might need throughout your application. If you need an alternative way of applying for this role, support with understanding the role and its requirements, changes to be made to the way we hold our interviews, or anything else, then please reach out to us. You can either let us know on your application form or contact the people team to discuss how we can help on careers@smg.team.


**SMG are proud to be an equal opportunities employer**


We are fully committed to providing equality in the workplace and ensure all opportunities for, and during employment, will be afforded to individuals fairly and irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, race including colour, ethnic or national origins and nationality, religion or belief or sexual orientation ("the protected characteristics"). We want our organisation to reflect the diversity of our communities and we welcome applications from people from all backgrounds. More information on what we are doing can be found here.


Our full data retention policy can be found here. Got questions? Take a look at our FAQ's here.

title: Head of Marketing
description:
* **Job Title:** Head of Marketing
* **Level & Responsibility:** This role will be a senior leader within SMG, responsible for leading our newly formed North America Marketing team.
* **Salary:** $100,000 - $150,000, depending on experience, and a discretionary bonus.
* **Location & Hybrid Working:** This is a hybrid role, with regular travel to our head office located in New York required.

**The role**


We are looking for a Head of Marketing to join our marketing team within our Threefold Agency (part of the SMG Network)*.* In this role, your success will hinge on your ability to drive best-in-class marketing campaigns, cultivate organic, earned & paid opportunities, and lead the team as a commercially-minded marketer. You'll take charge of setting and achieving Marketing goals, while also cultivating relationships with key stakeholders across SMG, our clients & partners.

**Why SMG?**


SMG is one of the most exciting growth companies in the North America today and is home to the award winning Retail Media Network agency **Threefold.**


Founded in 2008, Threefold is the world's leading Retail Media Network (RMN) specialist, headquartered in both London and New York. As part of the SMG agency network, which employs over 250 retail media experts, Threefold's primary mission is to unlock incremental CPG budgets, curate media campaigns that supercharge sales, and elevate its retail partners into top-tier omni-channel media owners, spanning in-store, offsite and online.


Threefold's services include consultancy, evaluation, and a white-label in-house solution that has seen the agency build, run and operate over 10 Retail Media Networks to date.

  

Today, Threefold run and operate Walgreens' Boots Media Group and Morrisons Media Group, and additional live partners include major retailers like The Co-op, Signet Group and The Very Group.

  

We are dedicated to supporting our employees to be the best version of themselves both inside and outside of work. We have an extraordinary culture built by exceptional people and it’s because of this that we’ve been recognised by Best Companies within the top 5 best Marketing & Media agencies to work for in the UK, with a World Class and Outstanding accreditation across the past 2 years.


We are also dedicated to continuously reviewing and improving our benefits package to offer the best that we can for our people. Here's what's on offer:


Generous discretionary bonus scheme


‍️ $3,510 yearly wellbeing fund (on top of your salary!) towards your personal wellbeing and passions


️‍ Healthcare paid for (dental, medical & vision) with the option to top up for family


Dedicated yearly investment into your professional development and learning


4 additional Wellbeing Days - one to be taken each quarter, dedicated to focusing on your wellbeing

  

Free headspace subscription


4pm Friday finishes all year round


Two fully paid conferences a year at Summer & Winter, as well as a dedicated team that put on activities and celebrations throughout the year

**Why you?**


In line with our company values, within your role you'll want to stay honest, stay hungry, stay foolish, and most importantly, have fun! The ideal candidate should possess a strategic mindset with the ability to develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies that align with SMG's business objectives in North America. They must demonstrate exceptional leadership skills, capable of building and managing high-performing teams while fostering a culture of excellence. The role requires strong analytical and financial acumen to effectively manage budgets, measure ROI, and make data-driven decisions. Additionally, you should have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, manage client and partner relationships, and elevate SMG's standing within the industry.  

  

Specifically, you will be able to demonstrate:

* Coaching and development of a high-performing and growing team.
* A proven track record in delivering business growth in a fast-paced, challenging environment.
* Significant experience in a marketing leadership role within a Sales organization in the Advertising industry, preferably with Retail Media experience.
* Strong marketing acumen, able to work seamlessly with data & stay at the frontier of trends to support commercial priorities.
* Flawless attitude at all times in all environments, with a strong will to succeed.
* The ability to work with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver best-in-class client service, at all times.

*P.s. we try really hard to make sure that we list only essential criteria here, BUT if you think you can do an amazing job, yet don't have every single thing on this list, we'd still love to hear from you.*

**What you'll be doing**


We pride ourselves on creating challenging and exciting opportunities, meaning that no two days are the same. However, here's an idea of what your responsibilities will look like:

* **Annual Strategic Planning & Marketing Org Design:** Develop and implement a comprehensive annual marketing strategy aligned with SMG's North American business objectives and total global marketing objectives. Design and structure marketing processes to effectively support these objectives, ensuring integration across all marketing activities.
* **Individual Marketing Function Planning & Execution:** Oversee the planning and execution of specific marketing functions, including branding, digital marketing, content creation, events, public relations, and demand generation. Ensure each function contributes to overall marketing goals and delivers measurable results.
* **Budget Management:** Manage the annual NA marketing budget, allocating resources effectively across various functions and campaigns. Continuously monitor and optimize ROI for all marketing initiatives, making data-driven decisions to maximize the impact of SMG's marketing investments in conjunction with Commercial leaders within the NA teams.
* **Tooling, Reporting & Responsibilities of the Marketing Functions:** Scope, develop, implement and optimize standardized tools, processes, and reporting mechanisms across all marketing functions working with the Global Marketing Director to ensure processes & tools are uniform across the total business where possible. Establish clear responsibilities and KPIs for each function with the Global Marketing Director, ensuring consistency and efficiency in marketing operations and performance measurement.
* **SMG Brand & Content Strategy for North America:** Lead the development and execution of SMG's brand strategy in North America, ensuring consistency across all touchpoints within the market and adhering to global guidelines. Oversee the creation of compelling content that reinforces SMG’s positioning, engages in topical dialogue, supports business development efforts, and engages and nurtures target prospects.
* **Client, Prospect & Partner Management:** Foster strong relationships with key clients, prospects, and partners through strategic marketing initiatives and working with SMG leadership to strengthen said relationships. Coordinate with the business development & retail partner teams to ensure marketing efforts effectively support client acquisition and organic growth goals.
* **Marketing Team Building, Management & Development:** Build and lead a high-performing marketing team, attracting top talent and fostering a culture of excellence in execution. Provide mentorship, professional development opportunities, and clear career paths for team members.
* **NA Leadership Cross-Team Collaboration & Communication:** Collaborate closely with other departments and leadership teams to ensure marketing strategies directly support business objectives. Facilitate effective communication and knowledge sharing across the organization to drive cohesive marketing efforts, understanding of the NA Marketing plans and performance, and highlight opportunities to improve Marketing’s contribution to business results.
* **Design & Execution of Prospect Nurturing Programs:** Develop and implement sophisticated prospect nurturing programs that leverage marketing automation, personalized content, and multi-channel engagement strategies. Continuously refine these programs based on performance data to improve conversion rates and accelerate the sales cycle.
* **Lead elevation of SMG's Standing with Industry Bodies & Trades:** Spearhead initiatives to enhance SMG's reputation and influence within key industry associations and trade organizations. Develop strategies for thought leadership, speaking engagements, and industry partnerships that position SMG as a leader in the North American market.

**Helping you shine**


We are committed to helping you shine and show your full potential by making any changes you might need throughout your application. If you need an alternative way of applying for this role, support with understanding the role and its requirements, changes to be made to the way we hold our interviews, or anything else, then please reach out to us. You can either let us know on your application form or contact the people team to discuss how we can help on careers@smg.team.


**SMG are proud to be an equal opportunities employer**


We are fully committed to providing equality in the workplace and ensure all opportunities for, and during employment, will be afforded to individuals fairly and irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, race including colour, ethnic or national origins and nationality, religion or belief or sexual orientation ("the protected characteristics"). title: IT Data Intern
description:
Job Description:
Introduction
At GAF, we cover more than just buildings. We cover each other. Under this roof, you will have the tools and resources you need to begin, grow, and develop in your career. Under this roof, you will experience our incredible culture and be empowered to support your teammates, your customers and especially your community through collaboration. Under this roof, we define the future while leading the present through our commitment to continuous improvement and never being satisfied with the status quo. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.
Summary:
Put your classroom studies into practice in the real world and gain the experience to help determine your journey after graduation. At GAF, we’ll make sure you get going on your very first day with a comprehensive orientation into our company. In our program, you will have the opportunity to own your own projects, participate in meetings, and work cross-functionally with other departments.
GAF is looking for a Data - Intern. The ideal candidate for this role is majoring in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering. This intern will assist with the development of new subject areas into GAF's Google big query data platform using tools such as Google Cloud Platform and Tableau for visualization and user enablement. The intern will have a great deal of opportunity to learn, contribute, and develop leadership skills.  

Essential Duties:* Develop a solution for a business need using Google Cloud Platform/Tableau Desktop
* Conduct analysis on functionality and features that are of interest to the team.
* Analyze data and generate insights to support the development of new products and features.
* Present at a monthly Data Analytics meeting to a cross-function group of analysts
* Learn support processes and participate in support rotation to address user requests and incidents
* Establish how new metrics will be defined and measured, and partner with business teams to operationalize reporting
* Deliver analytics and insights that are clear and digestible to non-technical stakeholders

  

Under This Roof, We Require* Pursue of Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution, with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0
* Minimum 2 years of experience in the field of data organization, validation, and visualization
* Fluency in expressing analytics needs, capabilities, and outcomes
* Experience working with BI and data visualization platforms
* Ability to communicate complex information with clarity and precision


Under This Roof, We also value* Excellent communication skills
* Conduct rigorous quality assurance to ensure the accuracy and integrity of data

  

How We Protect What Matters Most* We offer a wide range of health insurance options that include medical, dental, and vision for you and your family.
* Our Family-Building benefits support the many different journeys to fertility and parenthood.
* Our robust 401K plan includes an employer match contribution with your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions.
* Other exciting programs and perks are available to help employees achieve work-life balance, including (but not limited to) a wellness program, free financial coaching, a referral program, and product rebates when purchased for an employee’s primary residence.
* Professional growth and development are very important to us! We offer internal training programs and courses, as well as a generous tuition reimbursement program.
* We put diversity and inclusion into action with our Employee Resource Groups, which unite employees based on common perspectives, identities, demographic factors, or out of a desire to be an ally.

  

GAF complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact HR Services at 833-HR-XPERT.
We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).

title: Process R&D Intern
description:
Job Description:
Introduction
At GAF, we cover more than just buildings. We cover each other. Under this roof, you will have the tools and resources you need to begin, grow, and develop in your career. Under this roof, you will experience our incredible culture and be empowered to support your teammates, your customers and especially your community through collaboration. Under this roof, we define the future while leading the present through our commitment to continuous improvement and never being satisfied with the status quo. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.
Summary
Internship is a chance for you to learn about your chosen field in a real work environment with experienced GAF professionals. You’ll be involved in high-profile projects as an integral member of our working teams. During your assignment, you will have a mentor - someone who will act as a coach to help you better understand both our company and your work responsibilities. The Residential Process R&D team works closely with our New Product Development and Operations teams in order to scale up new products and technologies at the plant level. Activities may include working with and troubleshooting operation of pilot facilities to produce prototypes, developing process flow diagrams, identifying potential technologies to move forward with, and using these technical learnings to build a business case for capital investment.
Essential Duties  

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Problem solving, project management and communication skills are all necessary as is the ability to operate in a team environment. In addition, candidates must have the ability to generate accurate and concise technical reports.
* Developing and/or engaging with data flow diagrams/technical diagrams.
* Working under the guidance of a Process R&D Engineer, taking direction and completing tasks in a timely manner


Under This Roof, We Require* All candidates must have a minimum 2.8 GPA, at least sophomore standing.
* Candidates must be pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering.
* Candidates should also have computer skills in Google, MS Excel, MS Word, and basic knowledge of Auto CAD.


Under This Roof, We Also Value* As our team interfaces with multiple teams across the company, collaboration and communication skills are highly valued
* Innovation in the process space requires technical capability and creative thinking

Team or Function Overview
GAF is looking for a Commercial R&D Process Engineering Intern. The ideal candidate for this role is majoring in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering, Materials sciences, Polymers sciences or Chemistry. The intern would be responsible for joining the Commercial R&D PRocess team and working to enhance systems and processes that ultimately bring value to the customer as well as supporting GAF’s profitability. The Supply Chain Planning internship will have split responsibilities in the day-to-day R&D process which keeps the business operational, as well as project based assignments to bring efficiency and process improvements to the operation.

	+ Polymer extrusion
	+ Compounding / masterbatching
	+ Coatings manufacturing
	+ Underlayments coatings and laminations
* Analytical tests or measurement. May be including:
	+ Mechanical properties

	+ DSC
	+ DMA

Excellent communication skills are all necessary as is the ability to operate in a team. The successful candidate must be actively pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution, with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 and an anticipated graduation date between December 2025 and May 2026.

title: IT Infrastructure Intern
description:
Job Description:
Introduction
At GAF, we cover more than just buildings. We cover each other. Under this roof, you will have the tools and resources you need to begin, grow, and develop in your career. Under this roof, you will experience our incredible culture and be empowered to support your teammates, your customers and especially your community through collaboration. Under this roof, we define the future while leading the present through our commitment to continuous improvement and never being satisfied with the status quo. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.  

Team or Function Overview
As a Summer Intern, you will integrate with the IT Infrastructure & Operations team, gaining hands-on experience in the areas of system management (both on-premise and cloud based assets), infrastructure support, and operational improvements. You will develop core skills around monitoring, managing, and optimizing infrastructure operations. Your experience will extend to security protocols and incident remediation as well as learning about IT automation and optimization tools.  

Essential Duties* Learn and apply basic principles of infrastructure design, configuration, and operations
* Assist in the monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolution of infrastructure performance issues
* Help develop and track metrics for infrastructure performance, uptime, and reliability
* Participate in incident management and ensure issues are resolved within SLA guidelines
* Assist in managing infrastructure assets and inventory databases for on-premise and cloud environments
* Explore automation opportunities to improve operational efficiency and consistency across systems
* Collaborate on infrastructure audits for optimization, resiliency, and redundancy
* Assist in evaluating and remediating infrastructure security vulnerabilities, including patch management and system upgrades
* Participate in continuous improvement efforts to enhance the overall efficiency and reliability of infrastructure operations
* Assist in the Release and Configuration Management for deployment of Applications and related source code control management; design, implement, and maintain continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) pipelines.
* Help in the development of automated Cloud based Infrastructure service provisioning and deprovisioning (Infrastructure as a Code - IaC); monitor usage, and scaling services.

  

Under This Roof, We Require* Degree or pursuing degree in Information Technology, Systems Engineering, or related field
* Technical aptitude with an interest in IT infrastructure and operations
* Basic understanding of core infrastructure components such as servers, storage, virtualization, and networking

  

Under This Roof, We Also Value* Experience with scripting (PowerShell)
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure, especially within Azure and Google Cloud
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills in complex environments
* Knowledge of network operations and performance monitoring tools
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment
* An interest in Infrastructure architecture and cloud-based technologies
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for cross-functional collaboration

title: Service Attendant
description:
**About CORE:**

  

CORE: is a private membership-based company that provides curated access to individuals, experiences, properties, services, insights, culture, and entertainment. Our exclusive club in midtown Manhattan offers an elegant environment that is conducive to both business and relaxation. Our members are leaders in the fields of art, architecture, business, entertainment, fashion, media, politics, sports, science and technology.

 **Description/Purpose of Role:** Make sure that the club is clean and all areas are supplied at all times. Assist members with any questions or inquiries they might have.


**Responsibilities**:


* The Housekeeping House Person is responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the hotel
* Address guest's needs in a professional, positive, and timely matter
* Welcome and acknowledge each guest with a smile, eye contact, and a friendly greeting, using the guest's name when possible
* Thank guests with genuine appreciation and provide a fond farewell
* Respond promptly to requests from guests, Housekeeping Manager and Front Desk via Radio and mobile technology
* Wear a radio and Earpiece at all times for communication purposes
* Be aware of guest satisfaction scores and work toward increasing departmental and overall guest satisfaction
* Follow sustainability guidelines and practices
* Practice safe work habits, wear protective safety equipment and follow Material Safety Data Sheets and OSHA standards
* Follow all established departmental COVID-19 guidelines and SOPs
* Ensure a railroad checklist is followed so that the scheduled daily, weekly, monthly/deep cleaning is complete and because of the active environment of this hotel be aware of opportunities for deep cleaning needed in assigned area
* Preventative maintenance of operating equipment used in housekeeping
* Move, lift, carry and place objects weighing less than or equal to 55 pounds without assistance and in excess of 55 pounds with assistance
* Move through narrow, confined or elevated spaces
* Move up and down a ladder
* Maintain periodic cleaning of the public areas hallways, elevators, landings and any other assigned areas as needed
* Move at a speed that is required to respond to work situations
* Complete daily assignment/not limited to...
* Vacuum Guest Corridors daily
* Wipe down all walls, pictures, and tables daily (i.e elevator tracks/etc.)
* Spot Clean Carpet when necessary
* Complete daily special project - Per MOD
* Take out trash / change trash liners when needed
* Organize dirty linen
* Make sure guest corridors are clean and clear of all debris at all time
* Keep the Linen Closet clean and organized
* Manage and organize all guest request items
* Post caution signs (e.g. wet floor signs) to limit traffic when necessary
* Ensure that all metros with dirty linen are ready and staged for the scheduled delivery from the linen company, deliver the dirty and bring in the clean linen, sort and organize and evenly distribute it to the assigned floors
* Perform other duties as requested by management
* Support all co-workers and treat them with dignity and respect
* Assist individuals with disabilities, including assisting visually, hearing or physically impaired individuals with guidelines (e.g. escorting them when requested, using words to explain actions, writing directions on paper, moving objects out of the way, or offering access to Braille or TDD phones)
* Select appropriate cleaning chemicals and necessary personal protective equipment for various surfaces and cleaning jobs, following OSHA regulations and corporate Standards
* Ensure that the Elevators, buttons inside and outside the elevator and tracks are cleaned and sanitized throughout the day

 **Relationships and Roles:** Works closely with all departments in the club as their role is integrated throughout the club. Reports to the Director of Services.

 **Goals:** Have the club look meticulous at all times.


Assist members preferably prior to them asking; like have gym clothing out prior to appointment.

 **Skills & Abilities:**

* Proficient in English
* On top of happenings/events in public spaces throughout the day

 **Personal Qualities:**

* Detailed oriented
* Work well with other people
* Be able to work under pressure
* independent
* multi-tasker
* must be able to sit stand walk for extended periods of time
* must be able to lift 30 lbs.
* Must be available nights, weekends, and holidays

title: Unarmed Overnight Security Officer
description:
**Job Ad: Unarmed Security Officer (Overnight Shift) - Westin Princeton Hotel**


We are seeking a **dedicated and professional Unarmed Security Officer** to join our team at a busy hotel. This position is for the **overnight shift**, with hours from **11:00 PM to 7:00 AM**, on **Saturday, Sunday, and Monday**.

**Part Time**

**Salary: $17.00 per hour**

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Monitor hotel premises to ensure the safety of guests and staff
* Conduct routine patrols and respond to security incidents
* Maintain detailed reports and ensure attention to detail in all security-related matters

**Requirements:**

* Must have a **valid SORA Card**
* Strong attention to detail and ability to handle security situations professionally
* **Reliable transportation** to ensure timely arrival for shifts
* Commitment to professionalism and maintaining a secure environment


If you are reliable, proactive, and committed to maintaining a safe environment, we'd love to have you on our team!

**Apply Today!**

title: Remote Benefit Representative
description:
We seek two additional benefit representatives to meet remotely with clients interested in supplemental benefit plans. Successful reps are great communicators, ambitious, motivated, and organized. Responsibilities include contacting individuals, scheduling Zoom meetings, customizing benefit plans, and providing attentive customer service. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, and hearing insurance, company stock options, comprehensive paid training, and a flexible work schedule with the ability to work from home.
  
  

Weekly performance-based pay and bonuses average $65,000 to $68,500 in the first year.

title: Financial/Accounting Analyst II
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
The Financial/Accounting Analyst II will be assigned to the Corporate Finance department and will be responsible for Financial, Planning and Analysis and/or accounting responsibilities. The position will be accountable to support the management leadership team on multiples areas of the budgeting, forecasting and accounting areas. This includes working directly with large and small divisions including but not limited to health care management, commercial business unit, government programs, IT, legal and HR. This position is accountable for more complex analysis, reporting and/or accounting activities . Information generated by the FA II is submitted to management and leadership teams across the Enterprise.
Responsibilities:* Preparation, analysis and reporting of various financial activities, which may include: monthly, quarterly, and annual budgeting, forecasting and general ledger closing activities.
* Work independently in monthly general ledger close and/or forecasting and analysis activities. Anticipate the process, plan the calendar and execute pro-actively.
* Business Partnerships to the lines of business assigned where applicable. This may include: analyzing spend activities, reconciling general ledger accounts and preparing monthly accruals and transactional journal entries, remediating data and quality issues, supporting budget planning and analysis.
* Assigned to at least 1-2 special projects involving SGA enhancements, Internal Audit, new product development, medical cost ratio, investment, cash flow, billing or any business initiative as assigned by leadership.
* Create an annual process, facilitate the meetings, gather the data and build independent meetings with the business they support.
* Prepare ad hoc analysis and benchmarking for assigned divisions or companies including analyzing raw financial data as well as compiling reports, graphs and presentations. Conduct financial and operational analysis to provide meaningful inputs for decision making. Analysis may include: Analysis of Rx Rebates; assist in preparation of statutory and regulatory disclosures at a consolidated and standalone entity level; assist in analysis on certain delegated vendors supporting the calculations and payment of those activities (ie. Evicore, NIA, Navahealth).
* Ensure compliance by following, researching and interpreting guidance and documenting principles and issues related to transactions in different areas of finance.
* Preparing managerial reporting as appropriate (e.g. divisional reports, scorecards and regulatory reports including: assisting in reporting of DMHAS requirements which drives Medicaid capitation rates; BCBSA financial reporting including value based analysis and reporting; FEP reporting and analysis in accordance with the requirements of the BCBSA Directors office as well as the Federal Office of Personnel Management.
* Act as an interface and support internal and external audits, review activity and communicate guidelines, as needed.
* Variance analysis reports and financials; exhibit awareness of managerial reporting requirements and know when to escalate discrepancies or issues to senior colleagues.
* Conduct basic financial and operational analysis to provide meaningful inputs for decision making. Understand and educate customers on Horizon’s budgeting and general ledger closing processes and build understanding of gross margin and profitability and entity level business operations.


Disclaimer:  

This job summary has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by colleagues within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of colleagues assigned to this job.
Education/Experience:* High School Diploma/GED required.
* Requires a minimum of 2-4 years of finance experience, preferably in Financial Reporting, Forecasting or Accounting.
* Prefer previous experience working for a large Corporation with revenue in excess of $100M.


Additional Licensing, Certifications, Registrations:* CPA or other healthcare specific financial certifications preferred.


Knowledge:* Application of accounting principles to maintain general ledger (e.g., , processing of transactions, preparation of schedules, reports, documentation)
* Requires working knowledge of general accounting principles and methods;
* Working understating of forecasting and accounting for areas including fixed assets, investments and employee benefits as an example.


Skills and Abilities:* Strong analytical skills, business acumen and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong working experience with Excel, Access. Macros/VBA a plus.
* Adaptability and ability to work in a complex matrix environment.
* Experience with current Horizon systems and software a plus.
* Requires strong PC skills and ability to develop analytics and reports.
* Requires excellent analytical skills.
* Requires excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Requires excellent organizational skills.
* Requires the ability to work independently with minimal supervision at times.


Salary Range:
$68,500 - $91,665
This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. This range has been created in good faith based on information known to Horizon at the time of posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. title: RN II
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
This position is responsible for performing RN duties using established guidelines to ensure appropriate level of care as well as planning for the transition to the continuum of care. Performs duties and types of care management as assigned by management. Serves as mentor/trainer to new RN's and other staff as needed. Subject matter expert for the various projects and committees as needed.
Responsibilities:* Assesses patient's clinical need against established guidelines and/or standards to ensure that the level of care and length of stay of the patient are medically appropriate for inpatient stay.
* Evaluates the necessity, appropriateness and efficiency of medical services and procedures provided.
* Coordinates and assists in implementation of plan for members.
* Monitors and coordinates services rendered outside of the network, as well as outside the local area, and negotiate fees for such services as appropriate. Coordinates with patient, family, physician, hospital and other external customers with respect to the appropriateness of care from diagnosis to outcome.
* Coordinates the delivery of high quality, cost-effective care supported by clinical practice guidelines established by the plan addressing the entire continuum of care.
* Monitors patient's medical care activities, regardless of the site of service, and outcomes for appropriateness and effectiveness.
* Advocates for the member/family among various sites to coordinate resource utilization and evaluation of services provided.
* Encourages member participation and compliance in the case/disease management program efforts.
* Documents accurately and comprehensively based on the standards of practice and current organization policies.
* Interacts and communicates with multidisciplinary teams either telephonically and/or in person striving for continuity and efficiency as the member is managed along the continuum of care.
* Understands fiscal accountability and its impact on the utilization of resources, proceeding to self-care outcomes.
* Evaluates care by problem solving, analyzing variances and participating in the quality improvement program to enhance member outcomes.
* Serves as mentor/trainer to new RN's and other staff as needed.
* Acts as subject matter expert for respective area for projects.
